lines.text: "Objection!... Sustained!... This Courtroom is a Mochrie!"
[Props]

[balancing a sphere on his shoulder]
Do you have a table for Atlas?
This is me, Clive Anderson, saying "Good night," good night!
When's it gonna end, huh? The aggression.
When you give us our colonies back.
His colonies. Clive's colonies.

[planning a prison break]
Have you got the guns made out of soap?
Oh God, I wish I'd known. I've been making soap out of guns!

Improbable' where the mission is to 'get dressed']
All three of you get dressed individually. Otherwise, if you don't get dressed, you'll go outside and you won't have any clothes on. The government cannot be held responsible for the ramifications of this. If the secretary sees you without clothes he'll become aroused... and deny that he knows you. This tape will self-destruct in three or four days so use Royal Mail and make sure it goes nowhere.

[Dating Service Videos- Wearing a Greek Ruler hat]
I am Vishnu, the destroyer
[buzz]
Come with me or perish.
[buzz again]
Date me or face the bald man!
[Clive is really mad; Greg finally walks off]

[Superheroes, someone has just called out Useless Man]
Oh, Caterpillar man! That gives you more to play with, because Useless Man... is kinda what he is. Now what sort of crisis will he have to deal with?
Pants are too small!
Funny thing... have we ever done that?
If we have, I'm sure it was frought with hilarity!
So, with that challenge, let's go ahead. So pants are getting too small...
Which one am I?
You're Captain Caterpilar.
Captain Caterpilar.
And you can bring the elements of Captain Useless as well.
Look, I'll be Captain Caterpilar and you can just sit there and be Useless Man like you usually are.
Oh, you're winning tonight, as I can see. So, you might metamorphose into something...
Is it about time to make some sort of inappropriate American reference?
Not yet, you do the show.
Thanks.
The yakker.
I can take a few hits, if you want to...
Get on with it Greg!

[to Mike McShane]
If you got a duck blowing on one of your bladders, you're in deep trouble, my friend, deep troubles.

[Vasectomy Hoedown]
I fight fires in Germany/they really are the worst/I will now sing German/in my next verse

[In German]
Ich Leiber duch, dict, der mansion der exploden. Okatlot, Okadat, oh der trampolinen
Take it away, Greg!
You got it, Clive!
You sing it, Greg!
Alright, fresh funkmiester!
Sing before my funk gets stale!

[Motorway Hoedown]
Once I was in England/I met a man/He was shining bald, his name was/Clive Ander-san/I got a little nervous/shouted "Where is the freeway", he said/"No you silly twat it's called a mo-tor-way!
Olympic sports we'd like to see...
And now the-
[Steve Steen starts humping him]
Oh, God!
Yes sir, the Humping the Tony event!
I think Humping the Tony is actually in the Olympics
You ought to see the synchronized humping the Tony!

Welcome to Whose Line is it Anyway?, the improvisation show which, if you haven't seen it before, is the very best programme on the television. Or, if you have seen it before, you know it's one where I start off with a very big lie.
Welcome to 'World Leaders', my name is David Frost. I bring you world leaders, no matter what the cost.
[as Clinton]
I'm a sort of world leader, I'm a pleasant kind of a feller.
[as Mandella]
But I'm an even nicer bloke, my name's Nelson Mandella.
Last Halloween there were terrible blizzards, This was caused by a nasty old wizard. He looked out his window, and cast a fearful spell. And when I woke up in the morning I did smell.

Now I watch the trains, Lord, rolling down the track, I'm gonna get myself on that train, and I ain't going back. I'm gonna go from the top to the bottom, go down to the funnel, And then I'll be, can't see nothing, 'cause I'm in the train tunnel.
I have a little boy, you know his name is Tom. I was his daddy, but now I am his mom. I was a tough one, as tough as old Charles Bronson, Until I went to the hospital and they cut off my Johnson.

Well having a baby should be given to men, 'Cause when I have mine I killed my O.B. - G.Y.N. Hey, having a baby, it makes me want to beg, 'Cause nothing's more painful than seeing that thing drop through your legs. Ow!
If other hobbies leave you in the lurch, You can always break out your chisel, and carve yourself a perch. That's right, you can carve a marble or a granite, Just go ahead and have at it.
You may spend a couple of hours cleaning off the sediment, From that age old fallen pediment. But once you have done it you will notice with ease, That it's one of them Grecian frieze.
Well you know, carving is lots of fun. It's cheaper to buy rocks by the ton. I like it when I'm carving when I'm alone, But I find it's a lot easier when I'm stoned.

Everybody chisel your marble, chisel with ease. Chisel your marble please. Chisel your marble, chisel it right down, When you're sculpting you won't wear, you won't wear a frown. Chisel your marble, thats all I can say. Hit the stone and hit it every day. You can make most everything you want, Chisel your marble, chisel it right down.
[as a trendy vicar]
Dick. Call me Dick. Well, I would invent a sort of outreach, a sort of sharing...
Righty-ho, Mr. A.
Welcome to Whose Line Is It Anyway? The improvisation show that has been compared to Titanic. Not the film, the sinking ship.
[Party Quirks - Tony Slattery, as host, answers the "door" to Ryan Stiles]

[running in with his hands flapping behind his back like a sperm's tail]
Where's the women? Where's the women? There's no women here!
[World's Worst - Defence Lawyer]
Ladies and Gentlemen of the jury, it's not as if the sheep was under age.
Try it in the style of horror.

[to Merton]
What a horrible suit!
Oh, that's rich, coming from someone who's dressed like Doc Holliday!
[hoe-down about sex]
Oh, I'm a randy bugger; I really get around/I like to have a shag with everyone in town/I have lots of fun, I'm happy as can be/And that's cause my name is Tony Slattery!
[as old men in a nursing home]
I've got a big date tonight.
Oh really, ya going out for puddin'?
[indignantly, after John Sessions mimes urinating on the wall]
That was a genuine Chagall! And it's marginally better now!

[Let's Make A Date. Greg Proops is the contestant, and Steve Frost is a bachelor acting as a German U-Boat captain]
Contestant number one...

[pulls off one of his shoes]
Das Boot!

[Bungee Jumping Hoedown]
I was at the Eiffel Tower/Just the other day/ I jumped off/my braces they would sway/ I went down and I went up/ and down and up again/ I had so much altitude/ I ended up in Big Ben!
The Biggest Jerk in the World.
Tony?
[Tony gives her a look]
Naming a baby.
Well, he looks like a Clive...

[World's Worst things to see while flipping through channels]
It's Anne Diamond!

[in a trance]
No, I won't turn the channel Satan

[as an Alien]
Citizens of Earth, remain in your homes
[cracking up]
send me-
[buzz]
They're nipples, identical nipples!
It's the OJ Simpson trial, year 2550!

[goes up as Clive, immediate buzz]
OHHHH!
Hi, welcome to the serial killer home shopping network, and look at these knives!
Oh, it's that show where Clive patronizes everyone!
Don't bring Clive James into this!
No, I meant Clive Anderson!
It's the OJ Simpson trial- Hey, he's being defended by Clive Anderson! Ha!

[scenes from a Hat]
Elephants preparing to go on holiday.
[Paul Merton walks on]
Packing their trunks, I suppose!
[Paul walks back off]

[after a scene in a bathtub]
I think we've learned something from this, Delbert!
We sure have! Number One- never take a bath with another man!

[Superheroes]
Junkman. So, Greg is Junkman. What's a crisis that junkman can solve?
[Someone calls out "English Television" and everyone boos]
[laughs hysterically]
So, Junkman has got to solve English Television's problem. Although it's obvious that Junkman would just turn it into American Television!
[the audience boos]
Oh, that'll get the crowd on my side...
Bad call, homeslice!

[Tony Slattery sits down to do the bar scene]
Now, Tony is angry about something...

[sarcastically]
Oh, this will be clean.
We must kill that monster!
His name's Gary!
Gary!
Gary, Gary!
Salami is the breadth of life.
Salami is my world I live in.
I am your bread.
Yay for salami! Yay for salami!

[during a "Star Wars" Whose Line, as Luke Skywalker]
I read the Jedi handbook you gave me. I was a little confused by page one, where it says,
[reads paper with line]
, "My shorts are on fire".

[as Obi-Wan Kenobi]
Yes, it helps you to use The Force.

[Clive Anderson is picking a Superhero role for Colin Mochrie in the game "Superheroes". So far someone has suggested "Constipation Man"]
I think we can be a bit more elevated than that.
No-Hair Man!
No-Hair Man...
[Colin Mochrie angrily walks towards the person in the audience]

[Number of Words. Colin can only speak in four words, Steve can only speak in three]
Here's your omelette, sir.
I don't want!
[laughter from audience]

[Number of Words. Ryan can only speak in one word, Steve Frost can only speak in five, Niall can only speak in three]
Are you new?
No, I'm just... a little...
[tilts his head]
Inebriated?
Yes! You've seen through it!
A Jimmy Stewart convention.
[everyone goes up an starts doing an impression of Jimmy Stewart]
A convention of Cheese Makers. Wait, is it cheese markers or something...

[Jim, Chris and Ryan go up]
Well gentlemen, how's business.
Full of holes, as usual.
Wa-wa-wa-wa-wa-wa-Oh, I'm sorry, I'm at the wrong convention!
